title: Celeb dentist booted off American Airlines flight 'after arguing with flight attendants about Donald Trump'
text:
News Celeb dentist booted off American Airlines flight 'after arguing with flight attendants about Donald Trump' Shawn Sadri, who is of Iranian heritage, said he made a Trump joke and it ended up with him being escorted off by security Share Dr. Shawn Sadri (Photo: Getty Images North America) Share Get daily   
A celebrity dentist claims he was booted off an American Airlines flight because he argued with the flight attendants about Donald Trump. 
Shawn Sadri, who is of Iranian heritage, was on a flight from LA back to New York after working on stars ahead of the Oscars. 
He said the incident began when a little Latino boy sat next to him got upset and ran down the aisle screaming before take-off. 
Sadri said when a flight attendant came over to see what was happening he joked: "Maybe Trump is trying to deport him." Donald Trump (Photo: PA) Jason Wood, Ashley Nussbaum and Dr. Shawn Sadri (Photo: Getty Images North America) 
He said the flight attendant didn't seem amused and an argument assumed about the controversial President. 
Two more attendants joined in on their colleague's side and Sadri said he was eventually told he was being removed from the flight. 
Sadri told the New York Daily News: "I wasn’t yelling, I wasn’t swearing, it was 6 a.m., I hadn’t been drinking. 
"I’m a New Yorker - I’m not going to back down - and I was born a Muslim in Iran. I do think all those things played into it." American Airlines said Sadri was kicked off for "not following instructions" (Photo: Getty) 
Sadri was escorted off by security and put onto the next flight to New York which was an hour later. 
American Airlines told the Daily News in an email that Sadri was removed "for not following crew members’ instructions." 
The airline declined to comment further. Like us on Facebook
